title: IND Vs AUS, 4th Test: Jasprit Bumrah Leads India's Fightback After Sam Konstas' Electric Debut - News18
Dane Paterson five-for, Corbin Bosch's four rock Pakistan in Centurion - ESPNcricinfo
summary:
Dane Paterson five-for, Corbin Bosch's four rock Pakistan in Centurion

Date: [Insert publication date] | Source: ESPNcricinfo

South Africa's bowlers, led by Dane Paterson's five wickets and Corbin Bosch's four, dismantled Pakistan during the first Test in Centurion, leaving the visitors struggling at 209 for 9 by tea.

After a shaky start, an 81-run partnership between Kamran Ghulam and Mohammad Rizwan provided a glimmer of hope for Pakistan, but South Africa's relentless bowling proved too much. The match showcased tense moments, including a notable exchange between Ghulam and Rabada.

  • Dane Paterson recorded 5 wickets for 61 runs.
  • Corbin Bosch took 4 wickets for 63 runs.
  • Kamran Ghulam scored 54 runs, showing resilience.
  • Rizwan supported Ghulam with 28 runs.
  • South Africa reduced Pakistan to 209 for 9 by tea.
“It was frustrating for Pakistan after a magnificent first hour of bowling went unrewarded.”

In conclusion, South Africa's superior bowling attack showcased their dominance and left Pakistan struggling heading into the final session of play.
newTitle: Dane Paterson and Corbin Bosch Shine as South Africa Dominates Pakistan

Pushpa 2 UK Box Office: Breaks 7-Year-Old Record Of Baahubali 2 To Become No.1 Tollywood Grosser! - Koimoi
summary:
Pushpa 2 UK Box Office: Breaks 7-Year-Old Record Of Baahubali 2 To Become No.1 Tollywood Grosser!

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: Koimoi

Pushpa 2, after almost three weeks in theatres, has surpassed Baahubali 2's lifetime collection, becoming the highest-grossing Tollywood film in the UK.

  • After maintaining strong performance, Pushpa 2 has crossed Baahubali 2's record, a title held since 2017.
  • The film amassed £1.83 million in the UK in 21 days, just edging past Baahubali 2's £1.82 million.
  • The massive buzz around Pushpa 2 contributed to its success not just in India but also internationally.
  • The film's collection in Indian rupees stands at approximately 19.54 crores.
“It unleashed one remarkable feat at the UK box office by surpassing the lifetime collection of Baahubali 2.”

This milestone marks a significant achievement for Indian cinema, showcasing the growing popularity of Tollywood films in international markets.
newTitle: Pushpa 2 UK Box Office: Breaks 7-Year-Old Record Of Baahubali 2 To Become No.1 Tollywood Grosser!

5 Big Space Missions To Look Forward To In 2025 - Times Now
summary:
5 Big Space Missions To Look Forward To In 2025

Publication Date: Dec 26, 2024 Source: Times Now Digital

2025 promises to be a year of exciting space exploration. Here are five missions to watch out for.

  • Astronauts Finally Returning Home: NASA astronauts Butch Wilmore and Sunita Williams return from the ISS in March 2025.
  • NASA's TRACERS Mission: Launching in April 2025, this mission will study solar wind interactions with Earth's magnetosphere.
  • Artemis II Lunar Flyby: NASA plans its first crewed mission to orbit the Moon for 10 days without landing.
  • Tianwen-2 and BepiColombo Missions: China's Tianwen-2 will launch to study asteroid Kamo'oalewa while BepiColombo will explore Mercury.
  • India’s Gaganyaan Human Spaceflight: Set to send astronauts into low-Earth orbit, marking India's entry into human spaceflight.
"India’s Gaganyaan mission will make India the fourth nation to achieve human spaceflight, joining the US, Soviet Union, and China."

2025 is shaping up to be a pivotal year in space exploration, with key advancements and unprecedented missions lined up.
newTitle: 5 Big Space Missions To Look Forward To In 2025

AI told me to work out less and the results were a disaster - TechRadar
summary:
AI told me to work out less and the results were a disaster

Publication Date: N/A Source: TechRadar

The article explores a personal experience with the Push app, which uses AI to generate workout plans. After following the app's suggestion to reduce workout days from six to four, the author faced unexpected challenges and frustration.

  • The Push app was initially praised for its ability to track fitness goals and generate effective workout plans.
  • The author's experiment to reduce workout frequency aimed to enhance recovery but led to frustration and unmet expectations.
  • Transitioning to fewer workouts resulted in longer gym sessions that disrupted the established routine.
  • The author reflects on the importance of maintaining enjoyment and structure in fitness routines.
“I realized that I actually love having a reason to go to the gym every day.”

In conclusion, the experience highlights the significance of personal preferences in workout routines and the necessity for adaptability in fitness plans.
newTitle: AI Advised Reduced Workouts, Resulting in Dismal Experience

China approves world’s largest, $137-billion dam on the Brahmaputra close to the Indian border - The Hindu
summary:
China Approves Construction of World's Largest Dam on the Brahmaputra River

Published on December 26, 2024 by The Hindu

China has approved the construction of the world’s largest dam, costing $137 billion, on the Brahmaputra River in Tibet, close to the Indian border, raising concerns among neighboring countries.

  • The dam is planned to be built at a gorge where the Brahmaputra makes a U-turn into India and then flows into Bangladesh.
  • It is part of China’s 14th Five-Year Plan and seeks to control water flow in the region, elevating fears of potential flooding during conflicts.
  • The dam will have the ability to generate over 300 billion kWh of electricity annually — enough for 300 million people.
  • The project poses significant engineering challenges due to its location along a tectonic plate boundary.
  • The Chinese government emphasizes the project’s role in environmental sustainability and national security, alongside providing significant economic benefits to the Tibet region.
“The lower reaches area features a vertical drop of 2,000 metres over a 50km distance, representing nearly 70 million kilowatts of resources that could be developed.” - Yan Zhiyong, Chairman of Power Construction Corporation of China

This dam not only focuses on hydropower but also aims to promote cooperation in South Asia and enhance energy resources.
newTitle: China Approves Construction of World's Largest Dam on the Brahmaputra River

summary:

Publication Date: December 23, 2023

Source: Gadgets 360

The crew aboard the International Space Station (ISS) celebrated Christmas by sharing holiday cheer and emphasizing togetherness, even from an orbiting outpost 260 miles above Earth.

  • Astronauts created a festive atmosphere with floating decorations and a snowman made from storage bags.
  • They acknowledged the efforts of mission control teams on Earth who support their work.
  • The crew enjoyed a special meal and decorations that reminded them of their families.
  • Barry Wilmore highlighted the religious significance of Christmas during their celebrations.
“Merry Christmas” from our extraordinary vantage point!” - ISS Crew

The celebration highlighted the unity and collaboration that define both their mission and the holiday spirit.
newTitle: Astronauts Celebrate Christmas in Space with Festive Fun and Meaningful Messages

Trump tells death row inmates granted clemency by Biden to ‘go to hell’ in scathing Christmas Day message - Hindustan Times
summary:
Trump tells death row inmates granted clemency by Biden to ‘go to hell’ in scathing Christmas Day message

Date: Dec 26, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

In a recent Christmas Day statement, Donald Trump sharply criticized Joe Biden's decision to commute the sentences of 37 federal death row inmates. Trump directed harsh remarks at these inmates and the Democrats, expressing his disdain and opposition to the clemency granted.

  • Trump told death row inmates to “go to hell” in response to Biden's clemency.
  • The statement came after Biden commuted the sentences of 37 out of 40 death row inmates, many of whom include violent criminals.
  • Trump referred to Biden derogatorily as “sleepy Joe” and criticized the Democrats as “radical left lunatics.”
  • He vowed to “make America great again” in the upcoming weeks.
  • Trump’s comments were aimed at discrediting the Democrats' approach to justice and politics.
“To the 37 most violent criminals, who killed, raped, and plundered… I refuse to wish a Merry Christmas to those lucky 'souls' but, instead, will say, GO TO HELL!” - Donald Trump

This statement highlights Trump's controversial rhetoric and the political tensions surrounding criminal justice in the United States as he prepares to take office.
newTitle: Trump's Scathing Message to Death Row Inmates Granted Clemency by Biden

title: Microsoft is forcing its AI assistant on people—and making them pay | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Microsoft is forcing its AI assistant on people—and making them pay

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Company Business News

Microsoft is introducing its AI assistant, Copilot, to customers who may not want it, along with an increase in subscription fees for its Microsoft 365 services in certain regions.

  • Copilot is now part of the Microsoft 365 subscription in Australia and Southeast Asia.
  • Microsoft has raised prices for users of the subscription service as part of this rollout.
  • This move is part of Microsoft's strategy to boost excitement for its AI products.
“Microsoft is trying a new approach to build excitement for its artificial-intelligence assistant Copilot: Give it to customers whether they want it or not.”

This approach may raise concerns among consumers regarding privacy and the viability of forced upgrades.
newTitle: Microsoft Forces AI Assistant Copilot on Users Amid Price Hike

title: Barroz box office collection day 1: Mohanlal film gets dismal opening compared to Malaikottai Vaaliban - Hindustan Times
summary:
Barroz box office collection day 1: Mohanlal film gets dismal opening compared to Malaikottai Vaaliban

Date: December 26, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Malayalam-language fantasy film Barroz was released in theatres on December 25, directed by and starring Mohanlal. Despite the hype and its unique 3D filming, the movie only managed to collect ₹3.65 crore net on its opening day, which is significantly lower than Mohanlal's previous release, Malaikottai Vaaliban.

  • Barroz collected ₹3.65 crore on its opening day.
  • Malaikottai Vaaliban had an opening day collection of ₹5.65 crore.
  • Mohanlal promoted the film extensively before release.
  • The film is based on Jijo Punnoose’s novel Barroz: Guardian of D'Gama's Treasure.
“I have done a couple of Hindi films also. But now, most of my other films are dubbed into Hindi. When somebody calls me for a role I'll definitely come and work.” - Mohanlal

The film has faced criticism for lacking depth even though Mohanlal's performance received praise. Its future box office performance is uncertain.
newTitle: Barroz Box Office Collection Day 1: Disappointing Opening for Mohanlal's Directorial Debut

title: Not just fat loss, weight loss drugs are causing bone and muscle loss too: What it means - The Times of India
summary:
Weight Loss Drugs Linked to Bone and Muscle Loss: Understanding the Implications

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

Recent studies reveal that popular weight loss drugs like Wegovy, Ozempic, and Mounjaro are not only effective for fat loss but may also lead to unintended muscle and bone loss, which can have serious health implications.

  • Weight loss drugs can result in a significant reduction in body weight, with some users losing up to 20% of their total body weight.
  • Studies indicate that muscle loss accounts for 25% to 39% of total weight lost, while bone mass also diminishes.
  • The loss of muscle mass can worsen metabolic health and contribute to complications such as Type 2 diabetes.
  • Maintaining muscle and bone health while using these medications requires dietary changes and exercise.
“It is important to have strong bone and muscle health in order to do everyday activities with ease.”

In conclusion, while these weight loss medications offer life-changing benefits, users must be aware of and mitigate potential adverse effects related to muscle and bone loss.
newTitle: Weight Loss Drugs Linked to Bone and Muscle Loss: Understanding the Implications

title: Market Wrap, December 26: SENSEX, NIFTY end listless amid lack of major triggers; 155 stocks hit 52-week high on BSE - Upstox
summary:
Market Wrap, December 26: SENSEX, NIFTY end listless amid lack of major triggers; 155 stocks hit 52-week high on BSE

Date: December 26, 2023 | Source: Financial News

The domestic equity market remained mostly unchanged on December 26, 2023, as trading was subdued due to the holiday season and the markets being closed on December 25 for Christmas.

The S&P BSE SENSEX closed at 78,472.48, down 0.39 points, while the NIFTY50 ended at 23,750.20, up 22.55 points.

  • 31 out of 50 NIFTY50 components gained, with Adani Ports, M&M, and SBI Life among the top gainers.
  • 155 stocks reached their 52-week highs on the BSE.
  • The market breadth favored declines with 2,329 stocks falling against 1,639 that advanced.
  • Sagility India stock rose nearly 5% following positive guidance from JP Morgan.
  • NTPC Green Energy shares slipped 5.65% after the expiration of its shareholder lock-in period.
"Trading volumes are expected to remain light as we approach the end of the year, with more significant movements likely post corporate earnings in January." - Market Expert

The market's current state reflects the seasonal slowdown, but traders anticipate clearer trends once corporate earnings start rolling in.
newTitle: Market Wrap, December 26: SENSEX and NIFTY Show Limited Movement

title: 'Don't think anyone has treated Bumrah like that': Ravi Shastri doffs hat to teen prodigy Sam Konstas - The Times of India
summary:
Ravi Shastri Praises Teen Prodigy Sam Konstas for His Fearless Debut Against Bumrah

Date: [Insert publication date] | Source: Times of India

Former India coach Ravi Shastri has praised Australian teenager Sam Konstas for his commanding batting display against Indian pacer Jasprit Bumrah in his Test debut during the Boxing Day Test at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.

  • Konstas scored 60 runs off 65 balls, featuring six fours and two sixes.
  • His performance included taking 18 runs off Bumrah in one over, marking Bumrah's costliest over in Test cricket.
  • Shastri remarked that no player has treated Bumrah like that in any format, stating Konstas 'tore the MCC coaching manual to shreds.'
  • Australia ended the first day of the Test at 311 for 6 wickets, with strong contributions from their top order.
"I don't think anyone's taken or treated Bumrah like that in any format of the game, let alone red-ball cricket… It was something else." - Ravi Shastri

The impressive debut by Sam Konstas has sparked conversations about his potential and ability to challenge established players like Bumrah.
newTitle: Ravi Shastri Praises Teen Prodigy Sam Konstas for His Fearless Debut Against Bumrah
